result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen John Fifarek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
Good time.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes:
Plus attorney fees to be determined and paid first (as previously ordered $200/month).
To be repaid during probation.

May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact with T.S. - agent may modify as deems necessary.
Agent may impose no contact with R.F. if becomes necessary.

Undergo assessments, treatments and counseling as recommended by agent.
Provide DNA sample on 12-8-15.

Defendant Stephen John Fifarek in court with attorney Jane C.W. Hansen.  Kent Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
4pm

Atty Hansen agrees
Court arraigns def
Def pleads guilty
Federal firearms warning
Def addresses the court
Plea quest/WOR
Fact basis

ADA spks on sentencing
Atty Hansen spks on sentencing
Def addresses the court
Court imposes:
Imposed and stayed: 90 days jail with good time and huber release, if in compliance with jail rules and regulations. 
1 year probation:
Pay costs, DNA surcharge, $37 SF- to be repaid during probation
No contact with T.S- agent may modify as deems necessary
Agent may impose no contact with R.F if becomes necessary
Undergo assessments, treatments, and counseling as recommended by agent.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription
May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Def must give DNA sample
Appeal rights
